name: American
description: Slate blue or white. This rabbit has well-rounded hindquarters, narrow shoulders, and long erect ears.

name: American Fuzzy Lop
description: These small rabbits have a large, flatted "bulldog" face and lopped ears, and look somewhat like a Holland Lop with long fur. They have been bred in many different colors.

name: American Sable
description: Nose, ears, feet, and tail are a very dark brown, body a sepia color. Body is medium long and full, head narrow, and ears long and erected.

name: English Angora
description: Thick wool covers the entire rabbit, including the face and the stand-up ears, giving in the appearance of a large fuzz-ball. They have been in many colors.

name: French Angora
description: Medium long rounded body, ears long and erect. Face, ears, and front feet have short fur; rest of body has very long wool. Many different colors have been bred.

name: Belgian Hare
description: This rabbit has a lean racy body that looks more like a hare's than a rabbit's. Large upright ears.

name: Beveren
description: Pear-shaped body, long erect ears, dense coat of black, blue, or white.

name: Britannia Petite
description: These tiny, compact rabbits have relatively narrow heads and a trim, arched body line. Ears are medium long and erect. Colors include white, black, otter, chesnut, agouti (like a wild rabbit), and sable marten.

name: Harlequin
description: This striking rabbit originated in France. The body and head are banded with two colors. It has a medium-length body with rounded hindquarters, a rounded head, and long, upright ears.

name: Havana
description: Black, blue or chocolate colored. Body is short with wide shoulders and hind-quarters. Head is narrow, ears medium-long and upright.

name: Himalayan
description: White rabbits with ears, nose, feet, and tail colored black, blue, lilac, or chocolate. Body is long and narrow with narrow head and rather short erect ears.

name: Dwarf Hotot
description: These little rabbits have a very striking appearance, all white except for a ring of black around the eyes. They have compact, rounded bodies and short, upright ears.

name: Hotot
description: Like the Dwarf Hotot this rabbit is white with black ringing the eye. Body is rounded and thick, head is narrow, ears are medium-long and upright.

name: Jersey Wooly
description: Body is rounded and compact. The Fur on the face and upright ears is short the rest of the body has long dense fur. They have been bred in many colors.

name: Lionhead
description: This breed originated in Belgium but has been developed in England. Body is well-rounded. Fur on body is dense and of medium length, two to three inches long forming a mane.

name: Lilac
description: This rabbit is dove-gray with a pinkish tint. It has a medium-sized body with a somewhat narrow head and medium-long erect ears.

name: English Lop
description: Hinderquarters are rounded, shoulder and head narrow. The ears are lopped and extremely large, often measuring 24 inches from tip to tip.

name: French Lop
description: The largest of the lop breeds. This rabbit has massive, well muscled body with a wide head and thick, wide, lopped ears. The French Lop has been bred in many different colors.

name: Holland Lop
description: Head is slightly flattened, body is short and looks massive. They have lopped ears and a prominent "crowns" (the ridge of cartilage between the ears). These popular rabits come in many colors and have soft, fine fur.

name: Velveteen Lop
description: Body is mandolin, shaped, chest is full and rounded. The ears are lopped and measure from 14 inches tip to tip. Fur is like that of rex rabbits. It is being bred in several colors.

name: Mini Plush Lop
description: This breed was created in the late 1990s by Devie D'Anniballe by mixing the Mini rex, Mini Lop, and Holland Lop. The fur is like that of a rex, the appearance between that of a small Mini Lop and Holland Lop.
